com.whirvis.jraknet

Class RakNetPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.Packet
      • com.whirvis.jraknet.RakNetPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Acknowledge, ChatPacket, ConnectedPing, ConnectedPong, ConnectionBanned, ConnectionRequest, ConnectionRequestAccepted, CustomPacket, IncompatibleProtocol, NewIncomingConnection, OpenConnectionRequestOne, OpenConnectionRequestTwo, OpenConnectionResponseOne, OpenConnectionResponseTwo, UnconnectedPing, UnconnectedPong

    public class RakNetPacket
extends Packet
    A generic RakNet packet that has the ability to get the ID of the packet along with encoding and decoding.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • id

        private short id

    • Constructor Detail

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(int id)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket with the ID that will be written to it.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the RakNetPacket.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the ByteBuf. On instantiation, the first byte of the buffer will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuf to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(io.netty.channel.socket.DatagramPacket datagram)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the DatagramPacket. On instantiation, the first byte of the datagram will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        datagram - the DatagramPacket to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(byte[] data)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the byte array. On instantiation, the first byte of the byte array will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(Packet packet)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the Packet. On instantiation, the first byte of the buffer will be read and set as the ID unless the packet is a subclass of RakNetPacket.
        Parameters:
        packet - the Packet to read from and write to.
